meanings.definition: (adjective) of or relating to the condition in which the male and female reproductive organs of a plant mature at different times
meanings.sent1: The dichogamous flowers of the plant bloom at different times.
meanings.sent2: The gardener studied the dichogamous nature of the plant's reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The dichogamous plant confused the bees with its staggered blooming schedule.
meanings.sent4: The dichogamous behavior of the plant was like a dance where partners never meet.
meanings.sent5: The dichogamous pattern of growth made the plant unique among its peers.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that exhibits dichogamy
meanings.sent1: The flowers bloomed dichogamously, one after the other.
meanings.sent2: The plant reproduced dichogamously, ensuring cross-pollination.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed around dichogamously, visiting each flower in sequence.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the pollen dichogamously, spreading it far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The plant grew dichogamously, adapting to its environment over time.

meanings.sent1: The dichogamous in the garden fascinated botanists.
meanings.sent2: The farmer cultivated dichogamous for research purposes.
meanings.sent3: The dichogamous stood out among the other plants with its unique reproductive cycle.
meanings.sent4: The dichogamous was a subject of study for its distinct biological trait.
meanings.sent5: The dichogamous thrived in its ecosystem, adapting to thrive in changing conditions.
